page.title: 10Houses in Silverdale
page.content: "Greywalls" built about 1926 by the Sharp family who also owned most of the land and various farms in the area, is no longer a private house. Recently sold, it is to be converted into a residential home for the elderly. Hillside cottage is still part of the Sharp estate and tenanted. A new house is being built near to Hillside cottage, the only new house for many years. Brown's cottages are now privately owned. Number 3 cottage, once a small farm, is used as a holiday home for deprived children from Greater Manchester. Moss View House at Crag Foot once part of Leighton Hall Estate is now privately owned. Numbers 1,2, and 3 Marsh View Cottages were originally quarrymen's cottages,but are now privately owned two as permanent dwellings and one a holiday home.
